pullRequest.title: Quartz - Make jdbc store class configurable and use CMT store class by default

nodes.bodyText: Do we need to load the class here? We could use something like String.lastIndexOf("."), or?
What is this used for? It wasn't used before, or?

nodes.bodyText: You can remove that, the config doc generation will do that for you.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -38,4 +42,29 @@ */ @ConfigItem(name = "datasource") public Optional dataSourceName; + + /** + * The jdbc store class to use when the `db` store type is set. + *

+ * There are actually two seperate JDBCJobStore classes {@link org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreCMT} + * and {@link org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreTX} that you can select between, depending on the transactional + * behaviour you need. + *

+ * The {@link org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreCMT} is meant to be used in an application-server + * environment that provides container-managed-transactions. No commit / rollback will be handled by this class. + *

+ * The {@link org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreTX} manages all transactions for you by handling commit and rollback. + *

+ * If not specified, defaults to using {@link org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreCMT}.

nodes.bodyText: I wonder if it should be more generic and not tied to jdbc. I could envision some customization even if not jdbc.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -38,4 +42,29 @@ */ @ConfigItem(name = "datasource") public Optional dataSourceName; + + /** + * The jdbc store class to use when the `db` store type is set. + *

+ * There are actually two seperate JDBCJobStore classes {@link org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreCMT} + * and {@link org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreTX} that you can select between, depending on the transactional + * behaviour you need. + *

+ * The {@link org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreCMT} is meant to be used in an application-server + * environment that provides container-managed-transactions. No commit / rollback will be handled by this class. + *

+ * The {@link org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreTX} manages all transactions for you by handling commit and rollback. + *

+ * If not specified, defaults to using {@link org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreCMT}. + */ + @ConfigItem(defaultValue = "org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreCMT") + public Optional jdbcStoreClass;

nodes.bodyText: I think that this should be an error, or?

I believe that we should always rollback if something goes wrong, ie. right before throw new IllegalStateException("Unable to create Scheduler", e). Actually, we could change the catch block below to catch Throwable...

nodes.bodyText: InstanceHandle is AutoCloseable so you can just use try-with-catch (although it's not necessary in this case because the UserTransaction is @ApplicationScoped, but better safe than sorry ;-).
I'd rather use the enum constants, i.e. buildTimeConfig.storeType == DB || buildTimeConfig.storeType == JDBC_CMT.
I would deprecate this value and add a comment that it's retained for compatibility reasons and will be removed in 1.6 (or just "in future versions").
